greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least power of 2 to have at least n consecutive digits 'n' in its decimal expansion
comment: As it stands, the definition makes only sense for (decimal digits) n=0,...,9. Replacing "decimal" by, e.g., base-(prime(n)), the sequence could be defined for all n. (However, e.g., base-(n+1) would not work, since in base 4 no power of 2 has a digit "3".)
program: (PARI) A171252(n)={my(p=10^n, t); n*=p\9; for(k=0,1e9, t=2^k; until( n>t\=10, t%p==n & return(k)))}
results.author: _M. F. Hasler_, Dec 06 2009
